dialogueTree.title: Primer Book: "You see a colourful primer. The tit..."
dialogueTree.text: You see a colourful primer. The title reads: "A Primer for Small Kids."

links.title: Primer Book: "It's exactly like a primer -- a wor..."
links.text: It's exactly like a primer -- a word on every page relating to a letter of the alphabet.

links.title: Primer Book: "I'm not sure what you're planning t..."
links.text: I'm not sure what you're planning to get from this. It's meant for babies. Literal babies.

links.title: Plaisance: ""A highly educational primer. It's..."
links.text: "A highly educational primer. It's exceptional for the young mind... and obviously, very popular."

links.title: You: ""Oh wow, that's cool. I want to bec..."
links.text: "Oh wow, that's cool. I want to become smarter."

links.title: Plaisance: ""You're a grown man, though. It's a..."
links.text: "You're a grown man, though. It's a bit too late for that... this is a book for small children."

links.title: You: "I want to buy this Primer."
links.text: I want to buy this Primer.

links.title: Plaisance: ""Uh... you have kids?" She shudders..."
links.text: "Uh... you have kids?" She shudders uncomfortably. "Okay, I guess. Enjoy it."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You peek at the storekeep, waiting..."
links.text: You peek at the storekeep, waiting for her to be distracted. When she's not looking, you deftly swipe the small booklet off the shelf and stuff it in your pocket.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You now proudly own a primer book f..."
links.text: You now proudly own a primer book for small children which, to be honest, barely cost anything.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Slowly, you move your hand towards..."
links.text: Slowly, you move your hand towards the small book. Before you even can reach it, you're interrupted:

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant coughs sharply, then..."
links.text: The lieutenant coughs sharply, then whispers: "Let's not. Defrauding small business owners is not our *thing*."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Sir, please, no touching the merch..."
